biography: I have a passion for advancement in Human Computer Interface (HCI) technologies and have software and hardware patents in this area. My inventions have been featured on CNN and BBC and received best-of-class recognition by the Wall Street Journal and Popular Science Magazine.Our first product, the Swiftpoint GT mouse, launched with the help of the Kickstarter community, and went on to win Best Computer Peripheral at the largest tech show in the US (CES) with  IT Enquirer calling it the 'best pointing device of the 21st century".Last year we launched our "Z Gaming Mouse" on Kickstarter, which raised over 1/2 million dollars and was later voted Gaming Innovation of The Year.Before founding Swiftpoint, I worked in New Zealand and the US as a software engineer and project manager and co-founded the first specialist video game store in New Zealand.I am a huge fan of the Kickstarter platform and the ideas that it has helped bring to life. I'm proud to have supported dozens of amazing of Kickstarter creators.

biography: Hi there Kickstarter!  My name is Michael DeAngelo.  If you want, you can call me Mike.  I don't mind either.It's always been my desire to try and entertain people.  I want to create worlds where people go to get away from the monotony or stress of life for a few hours at a time.  I'm from the suburbs near Philadelphia, so I needed to pick up a hobby when I was young.About eighteen years ago, I started writing, and just never really stopped.  Along the way, I was fortunate enough to have five novellas funded right here on Kickstarter, and I was blown away by the warm reception.  Over the years, I ran two more Kickstarters—one for ten more books, and one for a tabletop game in my fantasy universe.I want to keep on bringing more people into my world, a magical place called Tellest.
name: Mike DeAngelo

biography:
Zen Bins creates unique stackable interlocking storage containers and custom inserts for your favorite dice/card/board games to bring a state of Zen to your gaming experience.Chris Kubicek and Brian Evans have been friends for many years and have combined a love of design/creation with a passion for all things gaming to bring you cool and affordable solutions to store your favorite games. Quality and attention to detail is important to both of us with our engineering backgrounds.  Along with our local access to state of the art thermoforming machinery, it allows us to mass produce our product quickly and ship directly from the US (Saint Louis, MO).To bring Zen Bins to market, Evans and Kubicek collaborated with friends, family and gaming enthusiasts to make the project a reality.About Zen Bins LLC:
St. Louis-based Zen Bins LLC is a custom game-storage company specializing in interlocking stackable “bins” for the most-popular collectible dice and card games.  Zen Bins take all the worry and headaches out of collecting, organizing and storing collectible dice and card games, while also facilitating play and trading.
name: Zen Bins

biography: I'm Katie, a storyteller based in Brooklyn. I'm a writer, editor, and photographer whose work has appeared in The Ringer, Marie Claire, VICE, Refinery29, Roads & Kingdoms, On Being, the Asian American Writers' Workshop, and elsewhere.Most recently, I was an editorial fellow at Guernica magazine. As a Spring 2017 TED Resident, I gave a TED Talk titled "As American as Chop Suey" about my photojournalism project on Chinese restaurant workers in New York. The photos and stories of these workers are collected in the exhibition Thank You Enjoy (which began as a project backed on Kickstarter), which is currently touring the U.S.In 2016 I contributed to the documentary project She Is Syria, which chronicles the stories of women and girl refugees. Previously, I edited award-winning books for Amazon Publishing and HarperCollins.  I relaunched Book of the Month as a box subscription service for books in 2015. I also co-founded and served as editor in chief of William & Park, a digital magazine for creatives.
name: Katie Salisbury
